bug.author: theoldhat
bug.description:
Hi, I am trying load a spaCy model trained in a linux Env to a Windows machine running spaCy. When I attempt to load the model from the model path I get the following: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31282809/47105040-de8ea480-d210-11e8-9be6-fa882d2eca63.png></denchmark-link>
The model loads fine when I try it on the Linux machine where it was created. The envs are as follows <denchmark-h:h2>Windows Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: Windows Server 2012 R2 Python Version Used: Python 3.4.2 spaCy Version Used: spaCy 2.012 Environment Information: Numpy 1.15.2
<denchmark-h:h2>Linux Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: Ubuntu 18.04 Server Python Version Used: Python 3.4.2 spaCy Version Used: spaCy 2.012 Environment Information: Numpy 1.15.2
I think it may be related to this issue: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/1634>#1634</denchmark-link>
but am not positive. Has anyone else experienced this? Thanks!

comments.comment: If this seems to be a common problem, I can submit a PR to try and fix it. I'll see if I can replicate the error on Windows 10.

I was actually just working through this and it looks like the issue was mine. I errantly had msgpack-numpy 0.4.4.1 installed and reverted to msgpack-numpy 0.4.3.2. After reverting things appear to be in working order.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
